title._content: Kimberly Crest," John Alfred Kimberly house, 1325 Prospect Drive, Redlands, California. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. [Kimberly Crest," John Alfred Kimberly house, 1325 Prospect Drive, Redlands, California. Drive with statice (Limonium perezii)] [1917 spring] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: French revival chateau, Dennis & Farwell, built 1897. Landscape: George Edwin Bergstrom, after 1905. Associated Name: Helen Cheney (Mrs. J. Alfred) Kimberly. Other: House built by Cornelia A. Hill. Today: House and garden an historic site. Slide used with lecture "California Gardens" as no. 34. On slide: Red line mark. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16025 Call Number: LC-J717-X97- 26
